briefdescription.para: Parse a sysfs cache size file that looks like "32K\n" or "12M\n".

simplesect.para: Cache size in bytes (>=0), or 0 if unavailable/unreadable.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort cache discovery on Linux sysfs.

detaileddescription.para: Fills l1/l2/l3 with detected values or leaves zeros if not found.

briefdescription.para: Initialize an ie_stream_policy with detected cache sizes and defaults.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize policy with detected cache sizes and sane defaults.
The policy may be overridden via environment variables documented in ie_stream.h. Cache detection is best-effort and falls back to conservative defaults when sysfs probing fails.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, or -EINVAL on invalid arguments.

briefdescription.para: Decide whether a copy/set of bytes should use non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para: Decide if non-temporal stores should be used for a given transfer size.
The decision uses the policy threshold unless forced on/off.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the memory operation in bytes.

simplesect.para: true if non-temporal stores are recommended, else false.

briefdescription.para: Recommend a prefetch lead distance for a given stride.

detaileddescription.para: Recommend a prefetch distance in bytes for the given stride.
Clamps the configured distance to a sensible range: at least one cache line, and at most roughly half of L1, while ensuring it is not smaller than the stride when stride_bytes is provided.

parameterdescription.para: Access stride in bytes (0 => assume cacheline stride).

simplesect.para: Recommended prefetch lead distance in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Issue a temporal (T0) prefetch at base+distance (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Issue a T0 (cache-hot) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.
On non-x86 builds this is a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset from base to prefetch.

briefdescription.para: Issue a non-temporal (NTA) prefetch at base+distance (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Issue a non-temporal (NTA) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.
On non-x86 builds this is a no-op.

parameterdescription.para: Byte offset from base to prefetch.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_t0

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range with temporal (T0) hint.

detaileddescription.para: Prefetch a range using T0 hint at a given stride and lead distance.
Walks a byte range [base, base+bytes) and issues prefetches at (current + distance), stepping by stride (or cacheline if stride==0).

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_nta

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range with non-temporal (NTA) hint.

detaileddescription.para: Prefetch a range using NTA hint at a given stride and lead distance.
Walks a byte range [base, base+bytes) and issues prefetches at (current + distance), stepping by stride (or cacheline if stride==0).

briefdescription.para: Scalar copy fallback for float arrays.
Scalar set fallback for float arrays.
Streaming store copy using AVX-512 (compile-time gated).
Streaming store copy using AVX2 (compile-time gated).
Streaming store set using AVX-512 (compile-time gated).
Streaming store set using AVX2 (compile-time gated).

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, const float *src, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_copy_f32

briefdescription.para: Copy a float array, optionally using non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para: Copy n floats from src to dst using optional non-temporal stores.

The function uses policy thresholds plus nt_ratio to decide whether to use non-temporal streaming stores. If nt_ratio is 0, the function forces a scalar copy even if the policy would otherwise stream.

parameterdescription.para: Ratio in [0,1]; 0 disables NT, >0 enables if policy allows.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, float value, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_memset_f32

briefdescription.para: Set a float array, optionally using non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para: Set n floats at dst to value using optional non-temporal stores.
The function uses policy thresholds plus nt_ratio to decide whether to use non-temporal streaming stores. If nt_ratio is 0, the function forces a scalar set even if the policy would otherwise stream.

parameterdescription.para: Ratio in [0,1]; 0 disables NT, >0 enables if policy allows.

briefdescription.para: Heuristics and implementations for prefetch and non-temporal (streaming) stores.

detaileddescription.para:
Implementation highlights:
Cache size detection on Linux via sysfs: "/sys/devices/system/cpu/cpu0/cache/index<N>/size" with units "K" or "M".
Environment overrides (see ie_stream.h header doc).
Careful handling of alignment before issuing wide streaming stores.
